titlestmt.titleproper: Secular Yiddish Schools in North America
Guide to the Secular Yiddish Schools in North America Collection M0732
titlestmt.author: Gella Schweid Fishman, Martha G. Krow-Lucal; and Anna Levia

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-05-25 13:18:20 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Secular Yiddish Schools in North America collection

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Friends of the Secular Yiddish Schools in North America

physdesc.extent: (130 manuscript boxes, 12 flat boxes, 2 oversize folders)

did.abstract: Materials include curricula, newsletters, instruction books, song books, school board minutes, photographs, newsclippings, memoirs, ephemera and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Materials include curricula, newsletters, instruction books, song books, school board minutes, photographs, newsclippings, memoirs, ephemera and correspondence. The collection is organized into three original series (Series 1. Yiddish School files; Series 2. Audiovisual materials, and Series 3. Artifacts) and a fourth series for material received in the 2011 accession.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of many donors, 1994-1998, and of the Friends of the Secular Yiddish Schools in America collection, 1999, 2001, 2002,2003, 2006, 2007 and 2011.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Secular Yiddish Schools in North America collection, M0732. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; materials must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.

Bender, Sabell. School Performances and Scripts for School Plays

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Play script "Treasures of a Century". 23 pp., first page missing. Three classic Yiddish authors (Peretz, Mendele and Sholem Aleichem) meet with some twentieth-century children and tell them stories of modern Yiddish culture and the events surrounding their grandparents' lives. Includes stories of Hershele Ostropolier and poems/songs by Rosenfeld, Bovshover, Edelshtat, M. Birnbaum and Z. Weinper. English with some Yiddish and some transliteration. Original. -- 3 1/2 x 5 card announcing "35th Annual Concert of the Los Angeles Kindershules and Mittelshules. 'Treasures sof a Century (A Pageant Celebrating 100 Years of Modern Yiddish Literature)'" by Sabell Bender. Yiddish and English. Original. -- Wilshire-Ebell Theatre printed program, a publication of the Playgoer Group of theatre magazines. Events taking place in the W-E Theatre during May, 1963, including Jewish Children's Schools Concert program, pp. 21-28. Short description of school curriculum on p. 28. English. Original. -- Bilingual leaflet entitled "Annual Concert of the Jewish Children's Schools of Los Angeles. A performance of 'Our Proud Heritage (A Pageant of Jewish History)'" by Sabell Bender. Yiddish and English. Original.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Yiddish publisher Oyfgang re children's books in Yiddish. SA. n/d. Minutes from SA 34 (Brooklyn) meeting, Jan. - Feb. 1965. Also includes notices for parent-teacher meetings, 1961-62; 1962 invitation to discuss banquet. Also includes 1963 note (typewritten, -Yiddish) from Yudl Mark to Shoshana David, requesting that she serve as recording secretary for pedagogical conference, 1963. Also handwritten Yiddish minutes of teacher council meeting SA, Jan., 1964, Nov. 1965, Feb. 1966, Oct. 1966.

did.unittitle: David, Shoshana. Personal Correspondence. From M. Herschberg, teacher in Pinski School (Farband), 1960. Also includes holiday cards.

David, Shoshana. Holiday Materials. Oyneg shabes program. No date, no location - program in honor of principal Shakhner on 70th birthday. Tu B'Shvat (on back, beginning of speech by Saul Goodman re Horace Kallen and cultural pluralism. Also includes handwritten Yiddish speech re Purim celebration. Purim games how-to activity. scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: M. M. Krug, S. M. Blumenfield, "The One Hundredth Anniversary of the Birth of I. L. Peretz." Chicago: Board of Jewish Education of Chicago, 1952. Trilingual (Yiddish, English and Hebrew) booklet. Each section contains a biographical sketch of Peretz, plus 2-3 of his stories. The Yiddish section begins with a song, lyrics by Peretz, music by M. Gelbart. Hebrew cover has woodcut of Peretz by Isac Friedlander. Includes suggestions for school assembly programs in English. Original.

did.unittitle: Weinman, Janice. Photographs. Workmen's Circle School of Skokie, Illinois, 1971 graduating class with teachers Jack Weinman and Isaac Malamedovich. Attached is note from Janice Weinman. Original.
Kirsh, Leah. Correspondence re SYSA Collection. Unsigned and undated one-page typed letter concerning the founding of the Fair Lawn, NJ Jewish secular school in 1955. English. Original.

Kirsh, Leah. Curriculum Material for Teachers. Emanuel Gamoran, "Methods of Teaching Jewish History. A Syllabus for Jewish Teachers." New York: Union of American Hebrew Congregations, 1950. 18 lessons, mostly composed of questions to the teacher concerning why and how Jewish history should be taught. Includes bibliography for pupils and teachers. English. Original. I. Goldberg, ed. "Sholem Aleichem 1959-1959." New York: Service Bureau of Jewish Education, 1959. 33-page booklet outlining biography of Sholem Aleichem. Includes bibliography and a portrait of Sholem Aleichem. Yiddish and English. Original.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: No author, no editor, "Khanike. Materialn far lerer." New York: Yidisher dertsiung biuro [=Service Bureau of Jewish Education], no date. 46-page mimeographed booklet containing various plays, songs and invocations for candle-lighting. Illustrations by Herb Kruckman. Yiddish and English. Original. Philip Goodman, ed., "Hanukah. Program Material for Young Adults and Adults." New York: Jewish Center Division of the National Jewish Welfare Board, 1953. 74-page mimeographed booklet containing blessings, Hanukah traditions around the world, plays, poems, games, songs with and without musical notation, refreshments, arts and crafts projects, stories and discussion topics. English. Original. Carl Wasserman, compiler, "Passover Haggadah/Hagode shel pesakh. Peninsula Jewish Folk Shule. Far Rockaway, NY. 1962." 9-page mimeographed booklet. Illustrations by Bernette Rudolph. English, Yiddish and Hebrew. Original. Lewis M. Moroze, ed. "Passover Haggadah." Newark: Danfred Publishers, 1965. 21-page printed booklet. Handwritten on cover: "Prop[erty] F.[air] L.[awn] Jewish Childrens School." Printed on inside cover: "Dedicated to the memory of James Chaney, Andrew Goodman, Michael Schwirmer [sic]". Illustrations by William Vigoda. English. Original. Carl Wasserman, compiler, "Passover Haggadah/ Hagode shel pesakh. Fairlawn Jewish Schildren's School. Fair Lawn, NJ. 1966." 9-page mimeographed booklet. English, Yiddish and Hebrew. Original.

Also songsheets for holidays and commemorations, including songbook for WC/AR youth group reunion, 11/83. Yiddish and English, lyrics only. Originals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Given at graduation ceremony from Sholem Aleichem mitlshul, NY, June 1944. Entitled ""Yidishe geshikhte durkh der yidisher poeziye." Also: speech delivered by B. Lederhendler in Sholem Aleichem shul 21 (Bronx, NY) at a gathering honoring the Lederhendler family upon their moving to Israel in June, 1974. Also: Speech to friends of SA shul 21, 1947-48, by B. Chinsky (Lederhendler). Also speech to friends and board members of SA shul 21, 1946-47, "Khanike un dos yidish kind." Also speech to adolescents at SA shul 21 re Hanukkah, between 1957-60. Also speech to adolescents at SA shul 21 re Hanukkah, 1947-48. All handwritten Yiddish. Also speech by B. Chinsky presenting the poet Avrom Reyzen at shul 21, 1947. Also Sara Lederhendler's graduation speech about the Baal Shem Tov. June 1965. Yiddish. Photocopy. Also speech for a graduation ceremony in the 1960s about poet A. Reyzn by M. Goldshteyn and B. Lederhendler. Includes some of Reyzn's poems. Yiddish. Original.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paper written in last year of Sholem Aleichem mitlshul, 1943-44: "Dos harts fun yidishn folk." Also a composition written by B. Chinsky (Lederhendler) for SA mitlshul in 1940, "dos hintl." Stapled to graduation speech given by B. Chinsky from SA folkshul 4, Bronx, NY, 1940; stapled to graduation ceremony flier for SA mitlshul, June 1944 and invitation to "oyneg shabes" flier, Jan 1945 (typed Yiddish, photocopy). Handwritten Yiddish. Photocopy. Also by Blume Chinsky. "Meynungen fun talmidim vegn der americaner yidisher shul," in Shul pinkes, 1948, pp. 521-25. Yiddish. Photocopy. Also various compositions by Melekhl Lederhendler, 1962-63. Yiddish. 2 originals, rest photocopies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Hagode far yugntlekhe." Prepared by Shmuel Lapin and Blume Chinsky, printed by Sholem Aleichem Yugnt-gezelshaft (according to notations by B. Lederhendler, composed of SA mitlshul graduates from 1946-48). No date. Yiddish. Mimeo original. Also "Hagode shel pesakh" for Sholem Aleichem shul 21, 1970. Yiddish. Photocopy. Also sheets for oyneg shabos songs, decorative map of Israel for Yom Hatzmaut, sheet with the 4 Questions in Hebrew and Yiddish, template for homework certificate for preschoolers. Yiddish. Photocopies. Also a song sheet for Pesach with brief explanations of what the 5 songs included mean. No date. Yiddish and English. Origianl. Also a program for a "Youth Oyneg Shabos" at SA shul 21, 11/69. Yiddish and English. Original. Also a reading for a Chanukah program at Sholem Aleichem shul 21, no date. Yiddish. Photocopy. Also a notebook of poetry, songs and recitations for oyneg shabes programs at Sholem Aleichem shul 21, 1957-58; another for 1958-59. Yiddish. Also leaflet inviting people to oyneg shabes where Blanche Chinsky would speak on "Jewish History Through Jewish Poetry". Jan. 1945. Yiddish and English. Photocopy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 beginner notebooks of Sarah Lederhendler, 1960 and 1961. Have lines typical of Yiddish cursive notebooks, but the covers (beginning at left) have "Writing Book" "The Property of __________" printed on it. Back covers have measuring tables (avoirdupois, liquid, etc.). Insides contain cursive Yiddish exercises, some corrected. Also: Notebook of Sarah Lederhendler, 1961-62. Contains 7"x8" lined paper, English school notebook. Contains exercises in cursive Yiddish (some corrected), photos cut from magazines and pasted in, a Purim songsheet. Also :copy of cover of notebook entitled "Sholem Aleichem shul," printed by SAFI. Copy of back cover shows lists of Yiddish words that come from Hebrew. Yiddish No date (photocopy). All others Yiddish originals.

Alto part. Contains various songs: "fun vanen kumt a yid," "dos iz undzer groyse mishpokhe," "in kamf," "asher levi dertseyl," "dray un tsvansik yidn," "a knal fun a duner," shtil is arum," "mir hobn mit mi...," "mir hobn gevunen," "azoy hobn mir," "vig lid," "azoy hot men oysgekemft." Also "a gut morgn," words and music by Hal Colter.

Pritkin, Leonard, in memory of Sonia Pritkin. Songs: Music and Lyrics. Leo Low, 1958, "Rosh hashanah l'ilanot (The Trees' New Year), Cantata for Solo, Mixed Voices and Piano." Yiddish original, Yehoyash; Hebrew ,Ruben Grossman; English, Babette Deutsch. "Uri adamah" in four parts, poem, B. Cohen; music, M. Bick. "Der yid der shmid" in four parts, text, W. Younin; music, V. Heifetz. "Yidish iz mayn loshn," four parts plus piano accompaniment, 1957. Poem, Z. Weinper; music, M. Rauch. Alto part of "Bar Kochba," words, Emma Lazarus; music, Irwin Heilner. "Amerike. Cantata for Tenor and Bass and Chorus." Poem, I.E. Rontch; music, G. Kingsley (1957). "'Ma nishtano' from the cantata 'The New Haggadah.'" Text, I. Fefer; music, Helfman. "O zet, zet" from "Moshiakh ben yosef," (1956) four parts. Text, B. Shteiman; music, J. Schaefer.. "Freedom Is Our Land" (arr. 1956). Lyrics, Lewis Allan; music, Lou Singer. Cantata "Oifn fidl" based on "Oifn Fidl" by Sholem Aleichem, for baritone, chorus and narrator with piano accompaniment. Choral text, I.E. Rontch; music, Vladimir Heifetz (1958).

Pritkin, Leonard, in memory of Sonia Pritkin. Songs: Music and Lyrics. "O, erdele!" Text, I. Dobrushin; music, A. Dishwang(?). "Sholem Aleichem's Vig Lid." 2 parts. "Peat Bog Soldiers/zumpland." Yiddish text, M. Olgin; musical arr. P. Schlosser. 2 parts. "Varshe." Text, Sh. Katcherginski; music, L. Weiner. Script from choral arrangement of I.L. Peretz, "oyb nit nokh hekher." Text, Itche Goldberg; music (missing), M. Rauch. Text of "Babi Yar" by Yevgeny Yevtushenko. Yiddish, D. Sfard; music (missing) M. Rauch. Text of "Dos gezang fun di velder." Yiddish text, N. Buchwald; music (missing) D. Shostakovitch. Various songsheets.
